She would like to increase her profits and be able to join other women in financing some containers. She envisions making her commercial work more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en:
Jayjay is 34 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, who are  9 months and 18 years old. Only one of them is presently in school, and both live at home.

For the past 20 years Jayjay has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She makes more profit, and she has too few goods in stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried bush meat, dried fish, pigs' feet, pepper, bitter ball, onions and rice, for her business inventory. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more dried bush meat, dried fish, pigs' feet, pepper, bitter ball, onions and rice, for her business,

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne Marie est une mère de famille agée de 44 ans qui a ouvert dans un quartier de la place,une alimentation.Son activité consiste à commercialiser des produits divers à l'instar des cartons de riz, de biscuits,sacs de spaguettis, bouteilles d'huiles.Pour subvenir à ses besoins,elle exerce comme activité secondaire,la vente de credit de communication,communément appellé CALL BOX.Pour ce qui est de son alimentation,elle sollicite un credit qui lui permettra d'augmenter sa clientèle,d'éviter les éventuels ruptures de stock et de rechercher quelqueqs marges bénéficiaires.Les benefices générés par ce credit l'aideront à faire grandir davantage son activité et par ailleurs à investir dans les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anne Marie is a mother with a family. She is 44 years old and has opened a grocery store in a local district. Her business involves selling a variety of goods, such as boxes of rice, cookies, bags of spaghetti, and bottles of oil. To support herself, she has a secondary business selling communication credits (phone minutes) commonly called CALL BOX. 

For her grocery store, she is requesting a loan enabling her to increase her customer base, avoid possible inventory shortages, have some profit margin. The profits generated by this loan will help her to enlarge her business further and also to invest in her children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase her inventory (rice, cookies, oil...)

loans.name: Zoodnooma De Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme  PINGDWENDESAFIATOU représente le groupe ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgés à 04 ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des habits et pommades depuis 02ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les  hommes, femmes et les nouvelles mamans.
Elle veut s’acheter  06  pièces de pagnes, 04 douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 30 boites de différentes pommades.	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  améliorer son activité, aider ses frères pour leur scolarisation et aider son père à construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. PINGDWENDESAFIATOU represents the group ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. She is in good health. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 4. One of them goes to school. She has two persons to support. 

She has been selling clothing and ointments for two years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers including men, women, and new mothers. 

She wants to purchase 6 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), 4 dozen of children's clothing, and 30 containers of different ointments. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to improve her business, help her brothers with their schooling costs, and help her father to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth, children's clothing, and different ointments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, tunta y chuño, producción de café, venta y costura de polleras, tejido y venta de chompas, inicio de negocio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta papa,, chuño y tunta (ambas anteriores son papa deshidratada) y tejido de chompas; cuenta que estos negocios los aprendió cuando vendía con su abuela, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, chuño y tunta) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amapolas" [Poppies] will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional hub.  It is comprised of six members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Hilaria is the president.

The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and include:  selling potatoes, chuño [artisanal freeze-dried potato], and freeze-dried potatoes; coffee production; sewing and sale of skirts; knitting and sale of sweaters; start-up businesses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesswomen, of whom Hilaria is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling potatoes, chuño, and freeze-dried potatoes (the former two are dehydrated potatoes) and knitting sweaters.  She recounts that she learned these businesses when she used to sell with her grandmother, many years ago.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (purchase of potato, chuño, and freeze-dried potatoes) that she will acquire wholesale from the markets in the city of El Alto, and later sell in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in the area of health and credit.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chuño [artisanal freeze-dried potato], and freeze-dried potatoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 49 años vive en compañía de Paulino, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todo menores a los que cuidan en la casa que compraron hace 15 años.  Todos los días junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios, los que cuida con mucho esmero, como le gusta mucho la agricultura y miró la manera de poder utilizar las sobras de fertilizantes y semillas, construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales, esto le sirve a ella para su propio consumo, “así no gasto mucho en los alimentos de mis hijos, además son de calidad pues son orgánicos”, comenta. En época de cosecha, comercializa sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus alimentos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee 2 vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto, pues quiere comercializarlos en la ciudad, aprovechando los viajes que realiza para comercializar sus propias cosechas. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias. Juana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Juana is forty-nine years old and lives in the company of Paulino, her husband.  Together, they have four children.  All the children are still minors and so Juana and her husband care for them in the house they bought fifteen years ago.  

Every day, Juana and her husband go out to care for the corn and potato crops on their own lands, which they tend with great care.  She likes agriculture a lot.  She saw a way of using the leftover fertilizers and seeds, and built a nursery in her home where she plants diverse herbs and vegetables.  This serves Juana for her own use: "In this, I don't spend a lot on food for my children; furthermore, [the herbs and vegetables] are of a good quality, since they are organic," she says.  

In the harvest season, she sells her products in the city of Huancayo, where she also brings her nursery foods to sell; she is already an expert of the city and of the businesspeople there.  She currently has two cows that she thinks of feeding and fattening in order to be able to milk them and thereby make cheese.  She hopes to solidify her new project, and to also sell these products in the city, taking advantage of the trips she already makes to trade the products from her own harvests.  

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She gives thanks for the opportunity offered to her, since she already will be able to improve her business.  In this, she promises to be punctual with the payments of her installments.  She likes to work within this organization, where all the people are responsible and supportive.

Juana will invest the loan money in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.name: Irimbere Group

texts.fr:
Claver fait partie du groupe Irimbere  et   habite à Gitega. Il  a   34 ans et est marié à Joséphine, une vendeuse d’habits. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 2  à 6ans, dont 1  étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un orphelin.

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis  2  ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait augmenter le capital pour acheter  des habits de plusieurs types. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants mener une bonne vie et continuer les études.
texts.en:
Claver is part of the group Irimbere. He lives in Gitega, and he is 34 years old and married to Joséphine, a clothing retailer. Together they have three children, from 2 to 6 years old; one of them is a student. Claver has an orphan in his care.

Claver has been doing commerce in clothing for two years. 

He is on his eighth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, in order to earn more

In the coming years, he would like to increase his capital to purchase several types of clothing. Furthermore, he would like to see his children lead a good life and continue in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase many clothes to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Makarimal Akhla 24 Yoff Group

texts.fr: Makarimal  Akhlakh  24 Yoff est un groupement   10 femmes membres   du  groupement d’intérêt  économique qui était  auparavant  un dahira  a travers lequel elles se réunissaient hebdomadairement, se cotisaient pour s’entraider.  Elles  exercent toutes  des activités génératrices de revenus et sont représentées par madame Aissatou   (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elle évolue depuis plus de vingt ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de tissus et sacs pour dame. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille ainsi que la location. Elle sollicite  un  crédit  dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement .Le crédit  sera  destiné  a l’achat de  tissus  et de sacs pour femmes qui seront destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices ,  élargir son activité  et mieux la fructifier
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh 24 Yoff is a group of ten women members of the economic interest group that used to be a 'dahira' (a religious association), through which they met weekly and paid dues for mutual assistance.   

They all have revenue-generating businesses and are represented by Ms. Aissatou (the one with her hand raised in the photo). For over twenty years, she has worked in commerce and sells cloth and women's handbags. The revenues that her business brings in enable her to cover her family's day-to-day expenses, as well as the rent.

She is requesting a loan with the goal of bolstering her working capital. The loan will be for purchasing cloth and women's handbags for resale. She would like to increase her profits, expand her business, and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and handbags to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Irafasha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Irafasha est composé de  8 femmes et un homme .Le jour de l’octroi du crédit, Sabine,  Joséphine et Espérance  trois   membres du  groupe, de sexe féminin  étaient malades. Sur la photo, elles ont été  représentées par leurs maris respectifs : Pascal, Bonaventure, et Jacques.
Anicet,  le représentant du groupe  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a  40  ans et est marié  à Jovanie. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de  5   à 15 ans, dont  4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce des produits de la forge (sceaux, malles métalliques,…) depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  tôles pour la fabrication de sceaux, de malles,…en grande quantité,   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il  voudrait faire le commerce de boutique(haricot, lait de beauté, chaussures,...). Il voudrait en outre, voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
The group Irafasha comprises eight women and one man. On the day the loan was granted, Sabine, Joséphine, and Espérance, three female members of the group, were sick. In the photo, they are represented by their respective husbands: Pascal, Bonaventure, and Jacques.

Anicet, the group's representative, lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Jovanie. Together they have six children, from 5 to 15 years old, of whom four are in school. He has a member of his extended family in his care who is a student. 

He has been doing commerce in hardware (buckets, metal trunks, …) for twelve years. 

He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of sheetmetal to make buckets, trunks, … in large quantities to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to do commerce in shop goods (beans, beauty lotions, shoes,…) Furthermore, he would like to see his children study and complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of sheetmetal for making buckets, trunks,... in large amounts in order to sell and earn more

loans.name: Makarimal  Akhlah 21-Yoff Group

texts.fr: Makarimal  Akhlakh  21 Yoff est un groupement   10 femmes membres   du  groupement d’intérêt  économique qui était  auparavant  un dahira  a travers lequel elles se réunissaient hebdomadairement, se cotisaient pour s’entraider.  Elles  exercent toutes  des activités génératrices de revenus et sont représentées par madame Fily  (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elle évolue depuis plus de vingt ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de tissus et sacs pour dame. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille ainsi que la location. Elle sollicite  un  crédit  dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement .Le crédit  sera  destiné  a l’achat de  tissus  et de sacs pour femmes qui seront destinés  a la vente. Elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices  et élargir son activité  et mieux la fructifier.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh 21 Yoff is a group of ten women members of the economic interest group that used to be a 'dahira', through which they met weekly and paid dues for mutual assistance. 

They all have revenue-generating businesses and are represented by Ms. Fily (the one with her hand raised in the photo). For over twenty years, she has worked in commerce and sells cloth and women's handbags. The revenues that her business brings in enable her to cover her family's day-to-day expenses, as well as the rent.

She is requesting a loan with the goal of bolstering her working capital. The loan will be for purchasing cloth and women's handbags for resale. She would like to increase her profits, expand her business, and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and handbags to sell

loans.name: María Gilma

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello y encantador municipio donde se dedica a diferentes actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la joven María Gilma.

María Gilma es una madre soltera, cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, ambos estudian, uno en la universidad y el otro en la primaria, a duras penas ella mantiene la alimentación de estos pequeños y los gastos universitario de su hija, pero también ve de gran necesidad de sus hijos poderle comprar una computadora para mejorar la enseñanza que tanto necesitan. 
Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad y su buen record crediticio que le ha ido logrando el desarrollo de sus hijos.  

Agradece a Dios por haberle iluminado de poder Solicitar un Crédito con Ceprodel y Kiva y espera que le brinden el financiamiento para poder llegar a obtener parte de sus principales sueños de lograr a darles una mejor enseñanza a sus queridos y amados hijos.
texts.en:
Achuapa, a beautiful and enchanting town, dedicated to various commercial activities – it is here where the young Maria Gilma lives.  

Maria Gilma is a single mother, who has two children under her care.   Both study, one in the university and the other in primary school.  She can barely afford to provide food for the children and pay the university costs for her daughter, but she also sees a big need of her children is for her to buy them a computer to improve their education, which they greatly need.  It is because of good health, her honesty and her good credit record that she has been able to succeed in developing her children.  

She gives thanks to God for having enlightened her to be able to request a loan with Ceprodel and Kiva and she hopes that they provide her the financing to be able to obtain part of her main dreams of succeeding in giving a better education to her beloved children.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana, de 48 años se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo desde hace 31 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven con 2 de ellos: Katy y Rosa en la casa que heredaron de sus padres hace 20 años. 
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con su asociación de la que fue invitada para progresar como los demás integrantes, se siente muy bien pues está convencida de poder triunfar con la ayuda de todos. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la siembra de papa, maíz y todo tipo de hortalizas, en terrenos agrícolas propios y alquilados. Aprovecha las largas jornadas en el campo para cuidar de sus animales como: vacas, toros, cerdos, “quien  sabe trabajar, dedica todo el día al cuidado de sus sembríos pues es importante tener de buena calidad”, comenta. Al mismo tiempo menciona que aprovecha los toros que posee, para hacer arado con la ayuda de su esposo. Asimismo cuenta que, el fin de semana aprovecha para vender comida, tiene muchos años cocinando y los comensales que visitan su puesto, consumen con frecuencia, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus sembríos, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Juliana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juliana, 48, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Antonio, her husband for 31 years.  Together they have five children, two of whom, Katy y Rosa, live with them in the house they inherited from her parents 20 years ago.

This is the second time she has worked with her association, which she was invited to join so she could make progress like the other members.  She feels very good because she's convinced she'll be able to triumph with everyone's help.

Her main income is growing potatoes, corn, and all types of vegetables on her own farmland and on rented land.  She makes the most of the long days in the field to care for her animals, such as cows, bulls, and pigs.  

"Someone who knows how to work spends the entire day caring for her plants," she says, "because it's important to have good quality.  At the same time she mentions that she makes the most of her bulls to do the plowing with her husband's help.  She also says she takes advantage of the weekend to sell food.  She has been cooking for many years and the diners who visit her stall eat there frequently.  This ways she gets some extra money.

She belongs to the Huaribamba solidarity group and this is her second loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy.  She hopes to get the loan to continue improving her fields, which is why she promises to make her payments punctually.

Juliana will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer to spread on her sown fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadira del Carmen tiene treinta y ocho años de edad, dos hijos de 16 y 11 años, es soltera y desde hace seis años instalo una pequeña pulpería en su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, con el objetivo de solventar los gastos de su hogar, solicita el crédito con el fin de poder surtir su pulpería en la compra de arroz, azucar, frijoles, sal, jabon, aceite, cafe, detergentes entre otros y así conservar a su clientela, quienes se mantienen fiel debido a la buena atención que ella les brinda, sus metas son mejorar su negocio y la estructura física de sus casa, pero principalmente que sus hijos terminen sus estudios sin ningún problema, Yadira agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua..
texts.en:
Yadira del Carmen, 38, is single and has two children, ages 16 and 11.  Six years ago she set up a small store in her home with a lot of effort so she could pay for her household expenses.

She's requesting the loan to be able to stock her store by buying rice, sugar, beans, salt, soap, oil, coffee, detergent, and other things.  This way she'll be able to keep her customers, who are loyal because of her good service.

Her goals are to improve her business and the physical structure of her house, but mainly for her children to finish their studies without any problems.

Yadira's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Milagro Elizabeth

texts.es:
Milagro, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y vende tortillas y ropa de forma ambulante para poder obtener ingresos y ayudar a su familia. Ella tiene tres años de tener el negocio, aprendió por iniciativa propia, lo realiza de lunes a sábado por las mañanas la venta de tortillas y  por la tarde vende ropa de forma ambulante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, que son los necesarios para realizar las tortillas, tendrá el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de los productos y así podrá continuar realizando sus ventas.
La aspiración de Milagro es darle una vida mejor a sus hijos, que puedan estudiar y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Milagro is 26 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 3.  She is a single mother and lives with her parents.  She sells tortillas and clothing on foot so that she can earn an income to help her family.  She has had this business for three years and learned it on her own initiative.  She sells tortillas on Monday through Saturday mornings and clothing on foot in the evenings.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn and firewood, which she needs to make tortillas.  This will give her the money she needs to buy the supplies and she will be able to make her sales.

Milagro’s aspiration is to provide a better life for her children who attend school to prepare for their future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvín, solicita un préstamo para poder continuar en el negocio de lácteos, en esta ocasión comprara un frízer para mantener mejor el inventario de los productos, ya que estará teniéndolos frescos con mayor duración.

Con el préstamo anterior le ayudo a que el negocio mejorara, logrando tener buenas ventas y que sus clientes estuvieran satisfechos con los productos que provee, en su familia considera que los ingresos que ha recibido por las ventas han subsanado sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Marvin is asking for a loan so that he can continue in his milk product business.  He will use the money to buy a freezer to keep an inventory of his products, since he will be able to keep them fresh longer.

He used the money from the previous loan to improve his business and he had good sales and his customers were satisfied with his products.  The income he received allowed him to provide the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que trabajar a través de ellos le ha permitido tener mayores beneficios en los cultivos, pues compra lo necesario para que su desarrollo sea adecuado y la producción, hoy se encuentra iniciando un nuevo cultivo para el que comprara abono y otros insumos necesarios.
Él considera que el efecto que le dio el crédito anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a mejorar sus ganancias con la producción de la siembra, esto le ha generado una mejor estabilidad, piensa seguir trabajando y contar con este apoyo de Padecomsm y Kiva, su deseo es a futuro comprar un terreno donde realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rudy has requested a new loan because he feels that working with them has allowed him to have better benefits with his crops and now he can buy the necessary supplies to have good production.  At the moment he is starting a new crop and he will buy compost and other supplies.

He feels that the previous loan was positive and it helped him improve his earnings with his production.  This provided better stability and he plans to keep working and count on the support of Padecomsm and Kiva.  His desire for the future is to buy land that he can work.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be a jovial and ambitious woman. She operates a farm stand where she sells milk from her dairy cows, maize, beans, vegetables, coffee, etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a productive agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Helina will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy more cows for dairy farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en:
Silvano, age 60, lives with his wife Delfina in Blue Creek village. One of Toledo’s most beautiful spots, Blue Creek is surrounded by mountains and rests atop of an underground water cave of over 5 miles. The few tourists that pass by Toledo most often pay a visit to Blue Creek to swim down the cave and see its numerous waterfalls. 

Silvano and Delfina have brought up six children, the youngest of whom is now 20. All of them have professional jobs in town whether it is in teaching, tourism or civil service. Delfina makes crafts such as bracelets and necklaces to sell to passerby tourists, and the family has opened their doors for homestays. Besides growing cacao, Silvano is also a medicinal healer of the Q’eqhci’ tradition. He cultivates over an acre of medicinal plants he uses in healing practices and opens for medicinal trail tours. 

The family is requesting the loan in order to double the capacity of the 2 acre and 800-plant cacao farm. Silvano says he is ready to be able to enjoy his house and farm, whereas now he still has to move around considerably for his tourism-linked activities. “I enjoy everything about being a farmer, I like to work,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao, confessing that he’s also looking forward to the days he gets to just sit around the farm. The more challenging part of cacao farming for Silvano are the many critters after the plant – if not the rodents chewing on the roots, you have to worry about leaf-cutter ants and birds as well as squirrels that often get to the fruit before farmers do. 

The loan will be used to set up an on-farm nursery and raise seedlings for the said expansion. Seedlings are cacao trees grown in bags for at least six months to get them ready for transplanting in the ground. Once planted, cacao trees take three to five years to start producing depending on the breed and whether the trees are grafted. Grafting is the process of inserting the tissue of one seedling into another and results in more productive trees that start yielding pods sooner than their non-grafted counterparts.

loans.use: Set up nursery to expand cacao farm

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Greetings from Kenya! This is Sidi, who is taking a loan from KOMAZA to plant a small-scale tree farm. Sidi is married to Runya, and the couple practices farming on their land in Chasimba. They grow maize, cow peas, coconuts, and tangerines. Sidi says that pests are destroying her maize, making the harvest small, and that the tangerine trees are also affected by the pests. 
When asked why she decided to join KOMAZA, Sidi replied that she hopes that it will bring development to her home and to her family, thereby increasing her living standard. 
If her KOMAZA trees grow big, she is hoping to get money to build a good home to replace the mud home in which she currently lives. She would also like to purchase cows to start producing milk for her family and to sell, and to modernize her farming techniques.
She says that if the trees are sold, she is sure that they will bring a big difference with the income that they generate, and that she will be able to do anything that she wishes. For example, she would like to have a big house to rent to earn an income, since she is getting old. 
Sidi is pictured here with her husband, Runya.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Remus

texts.en:
Remus is a forty-one-year-old farmer who lives in Chasimba. He is married and has seven children, six of whom are in school. Remus’s wife is a farmer. 
In addition to the income that he hopes to receive from the sale of his KOMAZA trees, Remus is also a butcher. He primarily sells beef and goat meat to schools in the area. He says that the major challenge to this business is a lack of clients. 
Remus said that he joined KOMAZA because it is a long-term project, and he is excited about the money in the future. He hopes to be able to purchase a business car with the proceeds from the sale of his KOMAZA trees. He would also like to build a rental house. 
When asked about his favorite part about working with KOMAZA, he replied, “the officers are perfect and excellent in their work”.
He believes that in ten years, he will be somebody else. He wants to operate a wholesale outlet for timber and hardware. His advice to other butchers is to join KOMAZA so that they can earn their living in a good manner. 
In the photo, Remus is pictured with his family.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Karen Yesenia

texts.es:
Karen Yesenia tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada, y tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia periférica de  San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Karen tiene un negocio de venta de comida, ella vende desayunos, almuerzos, baleadas, pollo con tajadas etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y los clientes son los mismos vecinos o personas que pasan por la zona. Dice que le va bien con el negocio, porque la comida siempre tiene mucha demanda a diario. En algunas ocasiones también vende comida por encargo. 
Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo a ODEF de 15,000 lempiras siendo este el segundo ciclo, con el cual va comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos como carnes, condimentos, granos, refrescos, harina, manteca etc. también otra parte va comprar un motor para tener agua potable, ya que ha tenido muchos problemas y esta inversión lo solucionará. Su sueño es lograr instalar el negocio en un local fijo donde haya mas transito de personas y Para obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen Yesenia is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Karen has a business selling food. She sells breakfast, lunches, baleadas (Honduran stuffed tortillas), pollo con tajadas (chicken with fried green plantain), etc. She has this business set up in her home, and the customers are her neighbors and passersby in the area. She says she says that her business is going well because every day there is a great deal of demand for the food. On some occasions she also sells food by order.

She has decided to request another loan from ODEF for 15,000 lempiras, as this is her second loan cycle. With the money she is going to buy the ingredients necessary for making the food, such as meats, condiments, grains, soft drinks, flour, lard, etc. With another portion, she is going to buy a motor so that she can have potable water, as she has had many problems, and this investment will solve them. 

Her dream is to set up her business in a permanent location where there is more pedestrian traffic. This is so that she can obtain better earnings, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making meals, and a motor so that she can have potable water.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  He and his wife run a pants and boots sales business. Even thought they began their business one year ago, they attracted quite a number of customers and now it is one of the income sources for the family. 

In 2006, he purchased a plot of land and built his own house.  The house they live in has a roof problem. In rain and snow, the roof does not protect the house from leaking. The house is also small and as his children grow he decided to add one room to his house.  

Erdenebat is requesting a loan for 4.500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase construction materials needed for roofing and adding a room. Construction materials needed include bricks, planks, cement, and iron. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place without fear of leaks. The fortified roofing will also stop the heat loss so that family will burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
Don Ramón de 57 años de edad, un  humilde señor originario de la Comarca las Banderas, casado, padre de 4 hijos, ya son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la compra y venta de piedras canteras, desde hace 20 años.  Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, el cual alquilaba   camión para poder ir a vender las piedras canteras a otros departamentos, luego con ayuda de un amigo logro comprar su primer camión, y con las ganancias que le genera este negocio, hoy en día él cuenta con dos camiones que los trabajan sus hijos y dos ayudante que salen a vender a otros lugares las piedras, de forma ambulante.

Ramón solicita el crédito  para comprar llantas, baterías, luces para el camión, toda la materia prima que necesita para poder  darle mantenimiento a sus camiones.  El estima que este préstamo  le será de gran ayuda porque de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas, obteniendo mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es cancelar dicho préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro crédito para poder comprar una parcela para tener algunos animales, unas de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Ramon is 57 years old and is a humble man from the Banderas settlement.  He is married and the father of four adult children on their own.  He is a merchant, sells quarried stone and has done so for 20 years.  He started as a merchant and then with the help of his friend he rented a truck so that he could go out to sell the stones in different departments.  Then with the help of his friend he was able to buy his first truck with the money generated from this business.  Now he has two trucks and he works them with his children and two helpers who go out to sell to other places.

Ramon is asking for this loan to buy tires, batteries, and lights; all the supplies he needs to be able to maintain his trucks.  He estimates that this loan will be a great help because he will be able to initiate sales, earning more profit.  His future plans are to pay off this loan and then request another in order to buy a parcel of land so that he can raise animals.  One of his goals is to improve the infrastructure in his home.

loans.use: to buy parts for his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque en su negocio ha sido una buena alternativa para crecer, comprara con los fondos prestados productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, azúcar, café, entre otros productos.
Ella manifiesta que ha tenido un cambio en el negocio, ya que la inversión anterior le dio más ganancias en sus ventas, surtió la tienda y con ello su familia se mantiene en mejores condiciones para alimentación y todas las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Olga is asking for a new loan because her business has provided a great opportunity for growth.  She will use the money to buy primary needs products such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and other things.

She says that she has had a change in business and the previous investment provided good profits in her sales.  She stocked her business and she and her family live under better conditions and have food and all the other basic needs.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Bayanzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayanzul, 43 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a kindergarten teacher for many years, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in the education field. Her eldest son works in Korea on an employment contract; he transfers money to his family each month. 

Bayanzul is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. Natural gas vehicles emit less smoke compared to other sources of propelled automobiles. Emitting less smoke shall contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The car she will purchase will be used by her husband for a taxi service as an income source.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle for use in a taxi business.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 25 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Christina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell beauty product business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ma. Christina has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the buy and sell beauty products for a year, and also earns an income from a general store.

Ma. Christina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her beauty products business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 22 years old and works very hard to provide for her family.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc..

Maribel has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc..

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marlyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, de 55 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Jorge, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos todos ellos menores, juntos cuidan de ellos en la casa que heredaron desde hace 3 años, y hace poco compraron una más al lado.

La seriedad de su mirada refleja lo trabajadora y luchadora que es. Pues a pesar de su edad ella, desea seguir sembrando, “estar en el campo me gusta mucho”, afirma. Es una mujer muy capaz, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos, cuenta con cultivos de papa, maíz y cebada, los cuales son su principal sustento e ingreso económico. Cuenta que en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde es conocida pues tiene muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de cultivo. Como buena mujer del campo también tiene animales entre: vacas, burros y cerdos, que le ayudan cuando más lo necesita, el pequeño burro que tiene, lo utiliza como animal de carga, ya que el lugar donde vive es muy alejado, además de los demás animales como la vaca y los cerdos, los comercializa cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.    
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus sembríos, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Lidia; invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, ya que esta en época de crecimiento y maduración.
texts.en:
Lidia is 55 years old and is a very hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Jorge and they have seven young children.  They care for them together in the home they inherited three years ago and they recently bought the one next door.

The certainty of her look reflects how hardworking and dedicated she is.  Despite her age she wants to continue planting, “I really like being in the fields,” she says.  She is very capable and rises very early every morning to care for her crops.  She raises potatoes, corn, and barley, which are her main source of income.  She says that she sells every harvest in the main Hucancayo market, where she is known and has many years’ experience in this type of crop.  Like a good farmer, she also has animals including cattle, donkeys, and pigs that help her when she most needs it.  She uses the small donkey she has as a pack animal because her home is very far away.  She sells the rest of the animals, so for this reason she promises to be on time with her payments. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy compost to feed her seedlings, since this is the growing and maturing season.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her ambulant vending dried fish business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities with her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 23 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Grace has a buying and selling root crops business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old and married with four children. With three of her children currently in school, Melinda works very hard to provide for them.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, spices, milk, etc.

Melinda has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, spices, milk, etc.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Djiguiya  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur treizième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales et d’habits. 
Fatoumata, qui est assise papier en main fait l’achat vente de céréales (mil, maïs, arachide, fonio, sorgho etc). 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400 kilos de fonio auprès des forains de  à Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités,  utilisé pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguiya group are all married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have three children each.  Most of them live in nuclear families, in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They are friends, neighbors, or have come to know each other through their commercial activities.  In order to boost their financial capacity and to improve their businesses, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their thirteenth loan.  They sell grains and clothes.

Fatoumata, who is sitting and holding a paper, buys and sells grains (millet, maize, groundnut, fonio, sorghum etc.)

With her loan, she intends to buy 400 kg of fonio from stallholders in Bougouni.  She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business, used to cover healthcare costs and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Myagmarsuren is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband Chimeddorj works at a local company. Her daughter Hongorzul, age 10, and son Hosbileg, age 8, go to a local primary school. The borrower has been working as a saleswoman in a local market for years and now is starting her own clothing retail business at a rental counter in a local market. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase the starting inventory for her new clothing retail business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and bright woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her clothing retail business

loans.name: Sikidia Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe  Sikidia  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 5 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de boissons non alcoolisées et des produits alimentaires. 
Bébé, qui a un papier en main fait l’achat et la vente de céréales (mil, maïs, arachide, fonio, sorgho et haricot). 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 500 kilos de mil  auprès des forains de   Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, utilisé pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the Sikidia group are all married women who are, on average, 33 years old and have five children each. Most of them live in traditional families, in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They are friends, neighbors, or have come to know one another through their commercial activities. In order to boost their financial capacity and to improve their businesses, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth loan. They sell grains, condiments, soft drinks and food products.

Bébé, who is holding a paper, buys and sells grains (millet, maize, groundnut, fonio, sorghum and beans).

With her loan, she is planning to buy 500 kg of millet from stallholders in Bougouni. She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 35,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business, used to cover healthcare costs and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Juvenal, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su madre, donde vive desde que nació.  
La siembra de diversos productos agrícolas es su especialidad, cuenta que durante todo este tiempo dedicándose a la agricultura, sembró toda variedad de papa, de diversos colores y tamaños, además de hortalizas, verdura y cereales. Cuenta con sus propios terrenos agrícolas las cuales le brindan muchas ganancias, pues cuida con demasiado cuidado del proceso de crecimiento. Pero como buena proveedora, también cría animales entre cerdos y ovejas, las cuales alimenta para venderlos, solo si tiene alguna necesidad, pero si no, los utiliza para el consumo de su esposo e hijos. Ahora desea mejorar sus cultivos e incrementar los ingresos ya que sus hijos son pequeños y necesitaran educación, “ahí gastaré mucho dinero”, afirma. Pero eso no es un inconveniente, ya que ella luchará por brindarle lo mejor que pueda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus sembríos, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Marina, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Juvenal and they have seven children which they care for in the home they inherited from her mother and where she has lived since birth.  Raising different kinds of crops is her specialty and she has been farming all this time, raising potatoes of different colors and sizes.  She also raises vegetables and grains.  She has her own farmland which provides her good earnings because she cares very well for her crops during their growth.

However, like a good farmer, she also raises animals such as pigs and sheep, which she raises to sell, but only if she needs to, otherwise she uses them for personal consumption. Now she wants to improve her crops and increase her income, since her children are small and need an education.  “I will spend my money there,” she says.  But this is not an inconvenience because she struggles to provide the best she can.

She is a member of the “Huaribamba” group and this will be her eighth loan through MFP and she fells developed and happy.  She hopes to get this loan so that she can continue to improve her crops and she promises to be on time with her payments.

Maria will use the money to buy compost to spread on her next crop.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as energy drinks, soap, milk, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell in her general store.

Melinda has been in this business for nine years. She also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as energy drinks, soap, milk, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Mildred requested a loan of 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy paint, wood, nails and other materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Mildred has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Mildred would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, nails and other materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata  est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Angoulême II de Ségou.
N’ayant pas fréquentée  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire la tresse, elle est douée d’un génie de création dans ce domaine. En plus de la tresse elle vend également des mèches. Elle est très connue dans la ville de Ségou et environnant. 
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à deuxième prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 625 mèches pour cheveux,  elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. Fatoumata   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100.000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Angoulême II neighborhood of the city of Ségou.

Since she did not attend school for social reasons, she began very early to work as a hair braider, and she is very gifted and creative in this field.  In addition to braiding hair, she also sells hair extensions.  She is very well-known in the city of Ségou and its surroundings.

In order to increase her business and meet her customers' demand, she has turned to Soro Yiriwaso and is on her second individual loan.

She is planning to use her loan to buy 625 hair extensions.  She buys her goods in Burkina Faso and resells for cash and on credit to a customer base which only consists of women.

She is expecting monthly profits to reach 100,000 CFA francs, which will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 53 years old, widowed with seven children.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nelly has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nelly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nezel

texts.en:
Nezel is 23 years old and married with one child.

Nezel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and soap to sell in her store.

Nezel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Nezel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 61 years old and married with five children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods and spices to sell in her store.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice bran.

Ninfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods and spices to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ponciana works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Ponciana is borrowing 29500 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell in her business.

Ponciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 53-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school.

Rebecca has operated an agricultural business in the Philippines for the past 20 years. She has requested a loan of 25000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 19 loans through NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business

loans.name: Azizmoh

texts.ru:
Азизмох проживает в городе Дангара. Ей 26 лет. Она живет с мужем. У них трое маленьких детей, один мальчик и двое девочек. Азизмох имеет среднее образование. 
Азизмох занимается торговлей на рынке. Она вместе с мужем обеспечивает семью. Ее бизнес приносит больше прибыли, но этого не хватает на жизнь. У Азизмох имеется собственная торговая точка, где она продает ткани. Она несколько раз кредитуется в Хумо. Азизмох берет кредит с целью увеличения оборота и ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Azizmoh, age 26, lives in the city of Dangara and has a high school education.  She lives with her husband with whom she has three young children, one boy and two girls.  

Azizmoh is a vendor at the market.  She and her husband provide for their family together, but Azizmoh's business brings larger profits.  However, this is still not enough to live on.  

Azizmoh owns her own retail outlet where she sells fabrics.  She has already taken a loan with MLO Humo and Partners a few times.  This time, she is taking a loan to increase her turnover and expand her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to buy textiles and fabrics (velvet, velour and cotton).

loans.name: Madine

texts.fr:
Madine   est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Missira de Ségou.
Ayant vite abandonnée les études,  elle commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires. Sa force de vente est due à sa maitrise du rouage du secteur d’activité. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle composée de femmes majoritairement.
Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour acheter en grande quantité dans le souci de réduire les charges de livraison, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est  à son 1er  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter 428 kilos  de fakoye  (condiments très prisés au Mali surtout au Nord),  elle s’approvisionne sur place.  
Madine   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 25 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de  pérenniser son commerce.
texts.en:
Madine is 56 years old, married and the mother of seven. She lives with her husband and children in the Missira district of Ségou.
Having left school early, she quickly started earning a living, in particular selling food condiments. Her high sales volume is due to her thorough knowledge of this business sector. She has a large number of customers, mostly women. With the goal of bolstering her working capital in order to stock up in large quantities and reduce delivery charges, she has turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to by 428 kg [about 944 lbs] of “fakoye” (a very popular condiment in Mali, especially in the North). She stocks up locally.

Madine sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both men and women. She  anticipates to earn a monthly income of 25,000 West African francs, which will allow her to stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Хабибулло житель Варзобского района. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Хабибулло портниха, она дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Хабибулло имеет высшее экономическое образование, но он не работает по профессии. Так как многие жители района предоставляют услугу (работают таксистами), из-за отсутствия общественного транспорта.
Хабибулло берет кредит для приобретения автомашины, которую он арендует. Он хочет купить машину и начать свою деятельность на своем частном автомобиле. Хабибулло намерен развозит пассажиров по маршруту Варзоб-Душанбе. Так как по этому маршруту нет общественного транспорта. Хабибулло хочет предоставлять услугу населению города и района.
texts.en:
Habibullo, age 26, is a resident of the Varzob district.  He is married and has two children.  His wife is a dressmaker and she works from home, sewing traditional Tajik outfits.  Although Habibullo has a degree in economics, he does not work in this field. 

Many residents of the Varzob district provide (taxi) services because of a lack of public transportation. Habibullo is taking a loan to purchase a car, which he is currently renting.  Habibullo wants to buy a car and start a business using his own private automobile.

He plans to transport passengers between Varzob and Dushanbe, because there is no public transportation along this route.  He wants to provide his services to the population of the city and the surrounding district.

loans.use: to buy an automobile.

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru:
Каримчон проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женатый молодой человек. Ему 39 лет. У него двое сыновей. Они учатся в школе. Жена Каримчона домохозяйка. Каримчон имеет высшее образование. Он четыре года проработал экономистом. Каримчон честный и справедливый по жизни человек. 
На сегодняшний день Каримчон открыл собственное печатное агентство, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение и заняться своим делом. Он приобрел необходимый печатный аппарат для распечатки баннеров. Чтобы начать свое дело ему необходимо приобрести материалы и краски. Он надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Karimjon lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is married. He is 39 years old. He has two sons, both in secondary school. Karimjon's wife is a homemaker. Karimjon has a college degree. He worked for four years as an economist. He is an honest and fair person. Recently, Karimjon has opened his own printing shop in order to improve his financial situation by launching his own business. He has bought a special printer to print banners. In order to launch his work, he needs to buy supplies and ink. He is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ink.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 5 enfants, les neuf femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine de Ségou. Elles font le commerce de savon, couvre lits, céréales (mil et riz), pagnes wax et bazin. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10ème  prêt solidaire.
Kadiatou (femme en 1ère position de la   droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse à Darsalam et dans le marché Médine Ségou de pagnes wax de qualité et de bazins.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 21 pièces de pagnes wax et bazins. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au grand marché de Ségou et parfois à Bamako. Avec ce prêt, Kadiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, assurer l’entretien et le scolarisation des enfants. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, elle  a pour ambition d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation avec l’épargne constituée avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Mainly married in monogamous households and on average 44 years old with five children, the nine women of the Benkadi group all live in the Darsalam area of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood relations, familial links, and their businesses at the Médine Ségou market. They run businesses selling soap, bed covers, cereals (millet and rice), pagnes wax (brightly printed West African cloth), and damask. With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth solidarity (group) loan.
Kadiatou (all the way on the right in the photo) is a major merchant in Darsalam and at the Médine Ségou market, specializing in high quality pagnes wax and damask. She intends to use her loan to buy 21 sets of pagnes wax and damask. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. With this loan, Kadiatou hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for her children's educational and other needs. Like the other women in the group, her ambition is to buy a plot of land to live on with the savings built up with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy pagnes wax (brightly printed West African clothing) and damask

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Korotoumou est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Pelegana Sebenikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquentée  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, elle finit par opter pour la fabrication et vente de la pâte d’arachide. 
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 84 mois, après avoir fait 4 prêts solidaires et 5 prêts  individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel.  Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter 700 kilos d’arachide,  elle s’approvisionne à Tona.  Korotoumou vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 80 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et de pérenniser son commerce.  Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Korotoumou is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her children at her husband's home in the Pelegana Sebenikoro area of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Not having attended school for societal reasons, she got involved very early on in revenue-generating activities with her mother, who sold condiments. After several years of training at her side, she finished by opting for the fabrication and sale of peanut paste.
With the goal of expanding her business to meet her clientele's demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has worked for 84 months. After having obtained four solidarity (group) and five individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her sixth individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 700 kg of peanuts, which she gets at Tona. Korotoumou sells her products in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will allow her to provide for her family and make her business more durable. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Mamou est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Pelegana Sebenikoro de Ségou.
 Ayant abandonnée  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle mène les activités génératrices de revenus depuis plusieurs années. Elle a commencé par faire la teinture et vente de bazins et par finir, la fabrication du savon local. Cette activité elle la mène depuis 2 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 72 mois, après avoir fait 4 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel. Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter,  2 barriques de pâtes de savons.   Elle s’approvisionne sur place à l’huilerie ‘’Bah Mariana ‘’de Pelengana. Mamou vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 40.000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge certaine  dépense  familiale  et de renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mamou is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her children at her husband's house in the Pelegana Sebenikoro area of Ségou.
Having ended her studies for societal reasons, she has run revenue-generating activities for several years. She began by dyeing and selling damask and currently makes soap in the local style. She has run this business for two years and enjoys a large clientele composed mainly of women.
With the goal of expanding her business to meet her clientele's demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has worked for 72 months. After having obtained four solidarity (group) and four individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her fifth individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy two barrels of soap paste. She gets her supplies locally at the "Bah Mariana" oil mill in Pelengana. Mamou makes her sales in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will allow her to take care of certain family expenses and strengthen her business.

loans.use: To buy paste for soap.

loans.name: Urselina

texts.en:
Urselina is 50 years old and married with nine children.

Urselina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soft drinks, soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

Urselina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Urselina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soft drinks, soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Assetou est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Sido Sonincoura  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée les études en classe de 7ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier,  Assetou commença à faire la teinture et vente des bazins teintés et foulards avec effigie  des noms de Saints en arabe,  auprès de sa mère qui était très connues dans cette activité. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle évolue seule après le décès  de cette dernière. Sa force de vente est due à son génie de création, elle arrive non seulement à calligraphier des textes du coran sur le foulard mais également à afficher la photo des gens.
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est   à son 1er  prêt individuel.  
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 8 pièces de bazins légers,  elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 90.000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et de pérenniser son activité.  Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Assetou is 38 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives with her children at her husband's home in the Sido Sonincoura area of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Having ended her studies at the 7th basic year (in the Malian education system) to get married, Assetou began dyeing and selling damask and headscarves with effigies of the names of saints in Arabic with her mother, who was very well-known in this field. After several years of training at her mother's side, Assetou continued by herself in this business after her mother's death. The strength of her sales is due to her creative genius; she is able to not only to write the text of the Koran in calligraphy on the headscarves but also to add people's photos.
With the goal of expanding her business to meet her clientele's demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan.
She intends to use this loan to buy eight sets of light damask. She gets her supplies in Bamako and makes her sales in cash to a clientele composed mainly of women. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which will allow her to take care of the household expenses and make her business more durable. Her ambition is to open a ready-to-wear clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguitougou est constitué majoritairement par des veuves. Ces quatre  femmes ont en moyenne 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le commerce de galettes, céréales, d’habits et friperie. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 13ème  prêt solidaire.
Salimata (femme en 2ème position  sur la photo de la  droite  vers la gauche) est connue à Darsalam et au marché Médine Ségou  pour la vente de céréales.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz avec les forains de la zone office du Niger. Elle revend en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé.
texts.en:
The Djiguitougou group is composed mainly of widows. These four women are on average 50 years old with five children. They all live in the Darsalam area of Ségou and know each other through neighbourhood and familial relations. They run businesses selling galettes, cereals, clothing, and second-hand goods. With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 13th solidarity (group) loan.
Salimata (second from the right in the photo) is known in Darsalam and at the Médine Ségou market for her cereal sales. She intends to use this loan to buy two bags of rice from the fairgrounds of the Office du Niger agency zone. She resells her goods at retail in cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. With this loan, Salimata hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and ensure her health needs.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Yolanda is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
