Jimmy started this business four years ago to support his family and is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to expand his business and earn greater profits. He intends to buy more maize and beans because prices are low, and sell after the season is over and prices go up. His dream is to finish construction of his house and pay for the education of his children. His main challenge is transporting his products to market because he is using a bicycle, and fluctuations in the price of agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: As the married mother of six children, Jacinta works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from firewood sales. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Jacinta has sustained her business activities with two previous loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este BC se llama “Fortaleza” lo constituyen 17 emprendedores quienes , la mayoría, se dedican a la venta de ropa, todos pertenecen a la ciudad de Puerto Montt, región Los Lagos.
Yazna Gomez, quien en la foto aparece de pie, la quinta de izquierda a derecha, viste polera negra; se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, su lugar de venta son las ferias, trabaja de martes a domingo. Adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago ( capital), mensualmente compra tanto ropa nueva como juguetes.
Yazna usa su crédito para ampliar su mercadería, obteniendo así mas variedad y cantidad en cada tipo de producto. 
Ella se ha fijado como meta de obtener un puesto fijo, establecido en un lugar de buena demanda, a su vez, en lo personal quiere seguir adelante con su negocio para poder educar a sus hijos.
Yazna es divorciada y vive junto a sus cuatro hijas.
Con mucho entusiasmo nos comenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda trabajar con Fondo Esperanza por la facilidad y comodidad de obtener los prestamos, además de las capacitaciones otorgadas, las cuales le han permitido ordenar su negocio y manejarlo de la mejor manera.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Fortaleza", or "strength" in English, and is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs.  All of them come from the city of Puerto Montt, in the Los Lagos region and most of them make a living by selling clothes.

In the photo, standing up, fifth from the left, is Yazna, wearing a black top.  She has been selling clothes for ten years at the markets, working from Tuesday through to Sunday.  She gets her merchandise every month in the capital city, Santiago.  She buys clothes and also toys.

Yazna will use her loan to increase her stock, by obtaining more variety and a larger number of every type of product.

Her goal is to have a fixed stall, in a place where there is high demand.  On a more personal level, she wants the business to move forward so she can educate her children.

Yazna is divorced and lives with her four daughters.

She enthusiastically tells us that working with Fondo Esperanza has been a big help.  It is easy and convenient to take out loans and, because of the training, she has been able to organise and run her business better.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region.  One of the attractions of Puerto Montt is its beautiful, green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its food and, particularly, its reputation for fish, seafood and artisan products.  It is also the gateway to the Greater Island of Chiloé, an island brimming with traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and toys.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa de 55 años de edad, expresa su agradecimiento por brindarle la oportunidad de su  primer Préstamo Kiva, con el cual logro  comprar toda la materia prima que necesitaba para la elaboración de su deliciosa comida, ya que sus pedios ha aumentado,  tiene un poco más de clientela, su primer crédito lo utilizo para la compra de pollo, arroz, aceite, y verduras. Pero su principal prioridad es ampliar su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. Está requiriendo de su segundo financiamiento para comprar, granos básicos, leña, arroz, pollo, tomate, papa, cebolla. Con el objetivo de crecer como una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en: Luisa, 55, expresses her gratitude for the opportunity of her first Kiva loan that she used to buy all the raw materials needed to prepare her delicious food since her orders have increased and she has a few more customers.  She used her first loan to buy chicken, rice, oil and vegetables.  But her main priority is to expand the business to meet customer demand and needs a second loan to buy basic grains, firewood, rice, chicken, tomato, potatoes and onions.  Her goal is to grow as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy basic grain, firewood, rice, chicken, tomato, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Milton Martin

texts.es:
Milton un humilde habitante de Granada, con  32 años de edad, acompañado, padre de 2hijos entre las edades de 3 y 8 años, el cual solo uno está estudiando su cuarto grado de primaria, el otro todavía no tiene edad para estudiar, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado del que es propietario hace más de 2 año. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven ayudándole a su papa, pero luego al independizarse el decidió emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, pero luego  se separó de su primera esposa y le dejo el negocio a ella para que lo administrara, actualmente él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos, negocio que le genera  ingresos a diarios, el cual se siente satisfecho porque le va muy bien y cuenta con clientes fijos. 
Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio. Milton solicita el crédito para comprar cuero, suela, pega, clavos, hilo para coser zapatos, etc. ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus zapatos, con el objetivo de dar un mejor servicios a sus clientela, sus planes futuros es ofrecer calzado de muy buena calidad y a un mejor precios.
texts.en:
Milton is a humble resident of Granada.  He’s 32-years-old, has a spouse and is father of two children aged 3 and 8; one attends fourth grade and the other one is still too young to go to school.  He’s a merchant.  He works manufacturing and selling shoes.  He’s owned the business for more than two years.  He started out in commerce since a young age helping his father but then became independent and decided to start his own grocery store.  But when he separated from his first wife she left the store to her so she could manage it and he currently works making and selling shoes, a business that generates daily income and gives him much satisfaction because he does well and has a regular clientele.

His expectation is to make the business grow. Milton asks for the loan to buy leather, soles, glue, nails, etc. to make shoes since he feels this loan will help him buy all the raw materials needed to make shoes.  His objective is to provide better customer service and his future plan is to offer very good quality shoes at better prices.

loans.use: to buy supplies like leather, soles, glue, nails and thread.

loans.name: Nazmie

texts.en: Nazmie is in her fifties, married and the mother of four children, one of whom still attends public school. She and her family live in a village which is not far from one of Albania's larger cities. Almost everyone in this village practices agriculture and raises livestock as a way to support themselves. Nazmie and her family go to the nearby city to sell their products. She has been in animal husbandry for nearly 20 years and is requesting this loan to buy a new dairy cow. She has taken out and repaid previous loans on time.

loans.use: to buy a new dairy cow.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 52 years old, married and has six children. To make a living, Trinidad makes and sells bamboo mats (sawali) to tourists and local community members. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Trinidad joined GDMPC. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase bamboo for manufacturing 'sawali'. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for manufacturing 'sawali' (mats).

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is married to Wilson and mother of three children. For the past 13 years, Catherine has sold new clothes in Kawangware. She earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. 

Catherine is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to build a stall where she can sell clothes and purchase more new clothes to sell. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to build a business stall and purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Olga Mercedes

texts.es:
Olga una humilde señora  habitante de Granada, tiene la  edad de  29 años, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  4, 9 y 12 años, actualmente los tres están estudiando, de oficio comerciantes, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y fritos. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 16 años vendiendo enchiladas, la cual le fue muy bien y de las ganancias que obtuvo, decidió vender nacatamales para aumentar sus ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia. Busco otra manera de ganarse el alimento de cada día vendiendo rifa. Actualmente sobrevive del negocio de venta de nacatamales  y paga los estudios de sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, pollo, tomate, cebolla, papa, etc. ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus nacatamales con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para obtener ingresos extras, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Olga’s a humble resident of Granada; she’s 29-years-old, married and mother of three children aged 4, 9, and 12 years.  Three of them currently attend school.  She’s a merchant; she works selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and fried plantain.  She started in commerce at the age of 16 selling enchiladas and did very well.  She decided to use profits obtained from that to sell nacatamales to increase income and get ahead with her family.  She sought another way to earn her daily bread selling raffle tickets.  Currently, the nacatamales business survives and she’s able to pay for her children’s schooling.

She’s asking for the loan to buy rice, chicken, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. because she feels this loan will help her buy all the raw materials needed to make nacatamales with the goal of increasing sales to earn extra income.  Her future plan is to improve her house’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She earns additional income from selling food. Janet has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of previous loans from NWTF. 

Janet is requesting a 10,000 KES loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 50 years old and separated with two children. She lives in San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. For the past five years, Justina has been selling fruit and she usually earns 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2009.

Justina is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy more fruit to sell. In the future, she hopes to generate more revenue and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Lavdim

texts.en:
Lavdim is in his 50s and has two school-aged children. He runs a construction business that has been going well. Lavdim lives with his family in a village in southwestern Albania.  Many residents of this village, who had immigrated to Greece, are returning due to the economic conditions in Greece. In general, the first thing they try to do is repair their abandoned houses. This generates more business for Lavdim. He plans to have his older son join him in his construction business and he hopes to employ others as well. Lavdim's younger son is doing very well in school. Lavdim plans to pay tuition and send his youngest to university since he has been accepted. 

Lavdim is requesting a 100,000 ALL loan to buy materials and tools for his construction business.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his construction business

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao has repaid his third loan of 60,000 KES. He has been able to build a bigger shed to house a larger number of animals and he also planted a variety of crops on his farm. 

Patao is requesting his fourth loan of 50,000 KES to buy more sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season. In the future, he hopes to earn more income and acquire a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season

loans.name: Marry Ann

texts.en: Marry Ann is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She manages and owns an office supply shop in her local community. She's been with her business for almost 3 years. She earns 7,500 PHP each month. Marry Ann joined GDMPC in 2007 and now is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional supplies to sell, like papers, pencils, etc. Marry Ann plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to sell, like papers, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmine is 57 years old and married with 6 children.

Jasmine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jasmine has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Jasmine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama still lives with her five children, who are under her care. She is an enterprising woman who has been operating a textile business. However, she diverted her line of operation and she now operates a beauty salon, which she says it is doing well. Salama gives thanks for the support she received and that she is receiving since it will allow her to achieve some of her goals. She is grateful for the previous loan which was a starting point for her prosperity. The loan she is asking is to allow her buy shampoo, creams, dryers, among other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, creams, dryers, among other beauty products.

loans.name: Verije

texts.en:
Verije, a 45-year-old Roma mother of five children, lives in a main city in the central Albania, within the Roma community. As many others of the same cultural background, she enjoys buying & selling second hand items and has been practicing this for the past ten years. 

Her husband does seasonal work in Greece during summer times and he buys used clothes there at a lower price compared to the price he had to pay to buy those items from sellers in his home country. Yet for the moment, Verije needs to buy items for the winter/spring season without waiting for her husband until summer.  She is seeking a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to purchase items to resell in the winter/spring season.

loans.use: To buy winter/spring used items to resell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a widow, age 34, and her four children are between 15 years and eight years old. She buys and sells fish in the Awasi location and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), this being her first term loan, and she intends to use this amount to purchase more stocks of fish for resale. The profits she earns will be used to reinvest in her business and to repay the loan. Her dream is to prosper in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Florita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for five years now. Florita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her fishing/fish vending business. In the future, Florita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This is David. In his own words: "I was once a civil servant where I used to earn income to support my family. After retiring from the service it was hard to support my family, and then I joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance. UGAFODE enabled me to educate my children and maintain a stable family at home because all the necessary requirements in a home, I would provide.

I have been able to start up a tree planting project and nursery beds where I now get money from the sell of tree seedlings of different tree types.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank UGAFODE very much for all the good services it is giving us and making me be part of this exercise. May God bless UGAFODE."

loans.use: To buy seedlings for the nursery bed, buy organic fertilizers, and hire labour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 62, has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She and her husband have four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest on his bakery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional used, but quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davaadorj, age 27, used to work as a security guard in a large grocery store before starting up his own taxi service business, transporting his customers via motorcycle in town. He lives with his wife and their two daughters in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt dwelling) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife runs a small organic dairy products production and sales business from her home. Their daughters Monhmandah, age five, and Uranmandah, age two, attend a local kindergarten. 

Mr. Davaadorj's wife has been producing organic dairy products and selling these to local customers for some time. She is well-known for her high-quality products among her customers. Mr. Davaadorj is requesting 600,000 MNT in order to purchase inventory for his wife's business. 

He and his wife are both hard-working, diligent, and enthusiastic people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his wife's organic dairy products production and sales business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel, age 44, has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Hazel has requested a PhP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase fishing materials for her business.

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
This is Aggrey. He tells his credit officer: "I am a self-employed Ugandan citizen working as a boda-boda (motorcycle) cyclist. At the same time, I own a small retail shop in Rwerere Town on the outskirts of Rukungiri Town. I started both these businesses with the small capital I earned from selling coffee and bananas.

"I was advised to get financial assistance from a financial institution since I wanted to buy a new motorcycle. I immediately joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in 2011 because it was well spoken-of in our community. UGAFODE advanced me an Asset Acquisition Loan in 2011 to buy a new motorcycle, and I have been able to improve and increase my earnings since then. I have been able to pay for my children’s school fees and maintain a stable family.

It is through UGAFODE that I have managed to accomplish this and I see that in a very short time my dream will come true: to graduate from a boda-boda (motorcycle) to a motor vehicle.

I thank UGAFODE for its good services."

Aggrey is requesting a loan in order to buy inventory items for his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for his retail shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married. Alice owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 13,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alice is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.  Lambayeque es una ciudad turística llena de historia y tradiciones que la hacen uno de los destinos más visitados en el norte del país.

La actividad que desarrolla María, es la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, bebida tradicional del norte del Perú. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido mucha experiencia y clientes.  El negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

María desea comprar una plancha  de eternit y tejerales, para el techo de su casa, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, single, and lives in home of her own, located in the Lambayeque district in a small community of approximately 50 families.  Lambayeque is a tourist city full of history and traditions that make it one of the two most visited destinations in the northern part of the country.

Maria makes and sells chicha, a traditional drink in northern Peru.  She’s been doing this for three years and she has gained much experience and many customers.  Her business is in her home and she learned this from her parents, so she knows the field perfectly.

Maria wants to buy roofing materials that will allow her to make improvements to her house.  She knows her business very well but also has a large space to make sales.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 29 years old. He lives in the Marneuli district with his wife and son. Vugar owns a bakery, which is stopped. Vugar has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to re-start his own bakery, but his loan requests have always been rejected in the past because of his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. Vugar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Vugar will purchase a dough breaker and will knead dough.  He will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. He owns a commercial space and he hopes his project will be profitable as he already has the baking experience and will offer quality products to his customers. This will increase his sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dough breaker

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 31, lives with her family; her husband and three children. She operates a food stall located in one of the busy markets in the town. 

Saumu wants to buy ingredients like flour, oils, basic grains, vegetables, sugar, and tea leaves. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. Her dream is to own a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, oils, basic grains, vegetables, sugar, and tea leaves for her food stall.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Victoriana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell for her firewood sales business.

Victoriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 28 years old. He is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a restaurant. It is a profitable business, but Ammar needs more support to cover his family's needs. He is a hardworking man who works 15 hours a day. 
He has applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER to help him and his family cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business. 
Ammar is very ambitious man. In the near future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a chicken grill for his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Evelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sheila Jane

texts.en:
Sheila Jane is married with 2 children. She is 23 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zambonga del Norte.

Sheila Jane is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested to purchase equipment and materials for her garden business.

Sheila Jane has become a member of PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Sheila Jane hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables to earn a living

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Исроил проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей, которые живут отдельно и занимаются своим делом. Жена Исроила портниха. Исроил имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии он не работает. 
Исроил более пятнадцати лет занимается торговлей на рынке. На сегодняшний день у него небольшой собственный магазин, где он продает шторы и занавески. Вместе с ним работает его жена. Жена Исроила шьет шторы на заказ, доставка и установка которых бесплатно. 
Исроил берет кредит для приобретения новых видов и расцветок метровых штор и занавесок.
texts.en:
Isroil lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 60 years old, married, and has three grown children who live separately from their parents. His wife is a seamstress. Isroil has post-secondary education and is an economist by training, although he does not work in this profession. For over fifteen years, Isroil has been a retailer at a market. Currently, he operates his own small shop where he sells curtains and blinds. Isroil's wife works with him: she makes curtains to order, which are then delivered to the customer and installed free of charge.

Isroil is taking this loan to purchase new types and patterns of curtains and blinds.

loans.use: to purchase new types and patterns of curtains and blinds

loans.name: Hatixhe

texts.en:
Hatixhe is a 42-year-old Egyptian lady. She is married and has four children who attend school. Unlike others of her community who live in the suburbia of major cities, she chose to live in a village and change her family’s life for the better.  
Even though she lives in a village, she still resells used clothes to residents around. Hatixhe has been reselling for ten years.

The loan she is requesting from VisionFund Albania is the second one; the previous has been paid. She wants to repair their house, and this is why she needs this loan.

loans.use: to repair her family's home.

loans.name: Merisyl

texts.en:
This is Merisyl, She previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for five years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merisyl hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education and giving her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 30 years old and married with 5 children. With 4 children who are in school, Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy extra items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, spices, etc.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy extra items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Arlette

texts.fr: Arlette est une femme de 28 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants. Elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits de beauté (huile de cheveux, défrisant, etc) afin satisfaire sa clientèle et ses prévisions de résultat. les bénéfices seront réintroduits dans son activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins familiaux (éducation, nutrition, logement) d'autre part.
texts.en:
Arlette is 28 years old and a single mother of two children. She owns and operates a hair salon in a district of the city, where she has been for the past two years. Thanks to her determination and dynamic personality, Arlette has turned many of her neighbors into loyal customers. She has gradually increased her customer base to the point where she feels the need to increase her stock of merchandise. 

Arlette wants to use this loan to buy beauty products (oil, hair straightener, etc.) in order to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue. She plans to use part of her income to reinvest in her business, and the remainder will be use to provide for the needs of her family (education, nutrition, and housing).

loans.use: to buy beauty products (oil, hair straightener, etc.)

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Artesanas” está compuesto por cuatro mujeres y un hombre todos son muy trabajadores muy responsables llevan varios ciclos trabajando con la institución  platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque Doña Luisa es artesana. Ella tiene 55 años de edad es una señora casada su esposo se llama Nicasio quien trabaja como artesano juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos que ahora ya todos son independientes. Doña Luisa  se dedica desde hace 18 años a la elaboración de artículos de plata como aretes, collares, pulseras, campanas, esclavas, etc. Doña Luisa comento “Decidí ayudarle a mi esposo con la elaboración de sus artículos porque mis niños eran muy pequeños y los gastos eran demasiado para que mis esposo los solventara al mismo tiempo” Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a la institución para comprar plata, piedritas, cajetas, lentes para soldar platica que lo primero que hacen es comprar la plata blanca, la funden para después calibrar los números que ellos quieran o se los pida el cliente, para después iniciar con la elaboración de sus artículos Doña Luisa comenta que para la elaboración de una campana se lleva aproximadamente una semana porque lleva varios tipos de arreglos, cuenta que en el mes de diciembre pudo vender tres campanas a una fundación del Banco Banamex a Doña Luisa dice que le gusta mucho su actividad solo que su única dificultad es el problema con su vista cada vez se le hace más difícil obtener una buena pieza y no le gustaría dejar de hacer artesanía lo que desea es que sus hijos también aprendan a realizar este tipo de artesanía para que ellos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con la institución y KIVA van a poder invertirle a su negocio como Doña  Sofía comprara alimento para sus borregos, Francisco, Isabel y Diana invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The “Artesanas” group is composed of four women and one man; all are very hardworking and responsible and have been working with the institution for several loan cycles.  They relate that they chose the group name because Luisa is an artisan.  She’s 55-years-old, married to her husband, Nicasio, who also works as an artisan.  They formed a family with seven children who are all independent now.


Luisa has worked for 18 years making silver items like earrings, necklaces, bells, bracelets, etc.  Luisa commented: “I decided to help my husband make his items because my children were very little and expenses were too high for my husband to cover.”  


On this occasion she’s asking the institution for a loan to buy silver, stones, jewelry boxes and welding goggles.  She relates that the first thing they do is buy white silver that they melt down to then calibrate the numbers they or their customers require and then make the items.  Luisa comments that in order to make a bell, for example, it takes about a week because it requires several types of arrangements.  She relates that in the month of December she was able to sell three bells to one of Banamex Bank’s foundations.  Luisa says that she likes her activity very much but the only problem is her eyesight that makes it more difficult each time to make a good piece.  She wouldn't want to stop making crafts and would also like her children to learn how to make this type of craft in order to have a better quality of life.


The group members are very happy and grateful to the institution and to KIVA because they will be able to invest in their businesses.  Sofía will buy feed for her sheep and Francisco, Isabel and Diana will invest in their grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy stones, jewelry boxes and welding goggles.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj is 62 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Battogoo, age 56, is retired and stays home. He runs a transportation service business in town and also works part-time at a local newspaper agency as a correspondent. His car has been broken for a while and needs repair in order to run his transportation business. He is now requesting a 1,150,000 MNT loan to repair his car. He is a hardworking, positive, and modest man.

loans.use: to repair his car to run his trasportation service business.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчону 24 года. Он со своей женой проживает в районе Шахритус. Умедчон 4 года как занимается земледелием. Он выращивает лук, картошку, зелень и другие овощи. Вести сельское хозяйство ему помогает жена. Чтобы урожай был богатым ему необходимы минеральные удобрения. Умедчон обратился в организацию за кредитом. Он берет кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений. За счет полученной прибыли с урожая он хочет приобрести 1 га земли.
texts.en: Umedjon is 24 years old.  He lives together with his wife in the Shahrituz region.  Umedjon has been farming for 4 years.  He grows onion, potatoes, greens and other vegetables.  His wife helps him farm.  In order to have a rich harvest he needs fertilizer.  Umedjon turned to the organization for a loan.  He is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer.  Using the profits from the harvest he would like to purchase 1 hectare of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru:
Маъруф   жизнерадостный молодой парень в возрасте 27 лет . Он проживает в посёлке. Маъруф  женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Его жена занимаются домашним хозяйством. Маъруф с 2004 года занимается купля - продажей крупно  рогатого скота. Он держит скот у себя в доме. Он сам по профессии маляр. Но то что он зарабатывает по профессии даже не хватает  на проживание. Поэтому он дома содержит скот и развивает этот бизнес. На данный момент у него закончился корм для скота а на корм у него не хватает денежных средств.
 На полученный кредит Маъруф планирует закупить несколько мешков корма для скота. Он хочет откормить скот  до весны и продать по выгодной цене. Маъруф благодарит организацию Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Maruf is a cheerful young man of 27. He lives in a small village and has a wife and one child. His wife takes care of the family's household. Since 2004, Maruf has been engaged in buying and selling cattle, which he keeps at home. He is a painter by trade, but his employment income is not sufficient even for basic subsistence. For this reason, Maruf also raises cattle and tries to develop this business.

Presently, Maruf has run out of animal fodder and has no funds to purchase more. He plans to use this loan to buy several bags of animal feed. He would like to fatten the animals until spring and then sell them at a profit. Maruf thanks MDO Arvand, LLC for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru:
Акмал житель района Бохтар. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Акмал живет с родителями. Жена Акмала домохозяйка. У них большая и дружная семья. Его брат находится за рубежом. Мать Акмала занимается торговлей на рынке. Акмал имеет среднее образование. 
Акмал два года предоставляет услугу на своем мотороллере. В повседневной жизни Акмал сталкивается со многими трудностями. В большой семье, большие расходы. Поэтому Акмал берет кредит, он намерен в свободное от работы время заняться животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа двух голов телят и одной коровы. Таким образом Акмал хочет заняться купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Akmal is a resident of the Bohtar region.  He is 24 years old.  He is married. He has two children.  Akmal lives with his parents.  Akmal's wife is a homemaker.  They have a large and united family.  His brother is abroad.   Akmal's mother sells at the market.  Akmal has a high school education.

Akmal has been providing services on his scooter for two years.  Akmal meets with many difficulties in his daily life.  A big family has large expenditures.  This is why Akmal is taking out a loan, he is determined to raise livestock in his free time.  He is taking out a loan to purchase two calves and one cow.  This way, Akmal would like to start buying and selling large livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and one cow

loans.name: James Steve

texts.fr: James est un homme de 28 ans, marié et 01 enfant. Il commercialise des produits cosmétiques et compléments nutritionnels dans un coin de la place depuis 1 an et 5 mois. Il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'il est obligé de faire écouler tout le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Il souhaiterai renforcer son stock de marchandises. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
James is 28 years old and is married with one child. He has been selling cosmetics and nutritional supplements in a corner of the square for the past year and five months.

Unfortunately, James finds himself constantly out of stock because he must first sell all of his merchandise in order be able to restock. This is due to his lack of capital. James wants to use this loan in order to increase the amount of merchandise he keeps in stock. He plans to save his income not only to expand his business, but also to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of cosmetics and nutritional supplements.

loans.name: Ahadjon

texts.ru: Ахадчон житель Шахритусского района. Ему 37 лет. Он женат, отец троих детей. Жена Ахадчона работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Ахадчон обеспечивает семью занимаясь купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занимается животноводством в течении четырех лет. Чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и расширить свой бизнес, Ахадчон берет кредит. Он намерен закупить телят. После его откорма, он продаст скот на рынке с наценкой. За счет полученной прибыли Ахадчон собирается сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Ahadjon lives in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. He is 37 years old, married, and a father of three children. His wife works at an orchard farm. Ahadjon provides for his family by buying and selling cattle. He has been raising livestock for the past four years. Ahadjon is taking this loan to make bigger profits and expand his business. He is planning to purchase calves and, after fattening them, to resell them at a profit. Ahadjon would like to use his profits to repair his home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married man. He has 2 children, aged one and 11. He describes himself as a determined and efficient man. He operates a restaurant where he sells doughnuts and snacks. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of ingredients. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy baking flour and cooking oil for preparing snacks and doughnuts to sell. His business goal is to run another restaurant within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy land and build a house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is also employed as a security guard which increases his income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and cooking oil for preparing snacks and doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Ol'ga

texts.ru:
Ольга  - фермер. С 1992 года занимается выращиванием пшеницы, подсолнечника и арбуза.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж, и дочь, которая работает бухгалтером.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с посева двух гектар пшеницы.
Ольга с мужем решила приобрести шины для трактора и прицепную борону для вспашки своих земельных участков. 
В планах на будущее:  заняться выращиванием черешневого сада, а также посадить виноград.
В личных планах: на будущее сделать ремонт своего жилого дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования шин для трактора, и прицепной бороны.
texts.en:
Ol'ga is a farmer.  She has been growing wheat, sunflowers and watermelons since 1992.   
Her husband and daughter, who works as an accountant, help her farm.  
She started her business by planting two hectare of wheat.  
Ol'ga and her husband decided to buy tractor tires and a harrow attachment to plow their plots of land.  
Plans for the future: start growing a cherry orchard and also plant grapes.
Personal plans: remodel their home.
She needs your help to finance the tractor tires and harrow attachment.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single lady, aged 28, blessed with two children, aged 13 and 11 years old, whom she supports. She owns a medical clinic in Awasi and has been in operation for a period of 12 years. Her monthly income is KES 20,000.

She has borrowed her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell.

The profit that she earns will be used tto buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell. Her dream in life is to see growth in her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell.

loans.name: Rustem

texts.en:
Rustem, a retiree from a village in southern Albania, is requesting a loan to add one more cow to his existing herd. 

People in his village have spoken about Rustem’s love for the animals and the extra care he shows to them. He lives with his wife and both manage business, yet laughing and in her presence he said,” My wife doesn’t do much labor. I do it all; she just comes around and pretends she is helping.” 

“This is my second loan, but I am responsible and I will pay my obligation, no matter what,” he added. “Adding another milk cow will increase production and will help us to put some money aside for rainy days,” his wife said. Kindly note that she did not want to be photographed.

loans.use: to add one more cow to his existing herd.

loans.name: Shaka Group

texts.fr:
Zainabu fait partie du groupe Shaka  et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a   44 ans et est marié à Ibrahim, un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de 3  à 24 ans, dont 5  étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de vêtements (habits)  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait  diversifier  les produits, en introduisant  les chaussures,  des assiettes  et des carreaux dans son commerce. Elle souhaiterait importer  ces produits de la Chine.
texts.en:
Zainabu is part of the Shaka Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 44 years old and is married to a carpenter named Ibrahim. Together they have six children between the ages of three and 24 years, five of whom currently attend school.

Zainabu has been a clothing merchant for the past ten years and is currently on her eighth loan with Turame. With the loan she receives from Kiva, Zainabu plans to increase her capital and purchase a large stock of clothing to resell and increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Zainabu would like to diversify her merchandise by introducing shoes, plates and tiles into her business. Zainabu hopes to import these products from China.

loans.use: to purchase a large stock of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie, 47, is married with two children, aged 16 and 18, and lives in Panlautan, Siquijor Island, Philippines.

She has been in business for eleven years and earns six thousand Philippine pesos (PHP) a month to cover living costs.

Now, since she's a good member of PMPC, she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP for her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hog raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic film and irrigation hoses for his greenhouse, as well as a motorized tiller

loans.name: Tajidin

texts.ru: Таджидину 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в Яванском районе. Двое его сыновей уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сам Таджидин зарабатывает на жизнь купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занимается животноводством уже 8 лет и в ведении этой деятельности ему помогает супруга. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес он просит кредит. Полученные деньги он истратит для закупа крупно-рогатого скота и  после его откорма продаст на рынке с наценкой.
texts.en: Tajidin is 58 years old.  He is married and has 5 children.  He lives with his family in the Yavan region.  Two of his sons left to work in the Russian Federation.  Tajidin earns money to live on by buying and selling large livestock.  He has been raising livestock for 8 years already and his spouse helps him in this business.  He is asking for a loan to expand his business.  He will spend the money to purchase large livestock and after fattening it, he will sell it at the market for a markup.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large supply of mandarins for resale.

loans.name: Mahmarajab

texts.ru: Махмараджаб житель Яванского района. Ему 44 года. Он женат, имеет пятерых детей. С 1997 года Махмараджаб работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Он в основном занимается посевом пшеницы, овощей. В ведении сельского хозяйства ему помогает семья. Недавно Махмараджаб истратил свои сбережения  на приобретение скота и для посева у него не осталось достаточных денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом в Хумо. Он берет кредит для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. За счет полученной прибыли он надеется улучшить финансовое положение, приобрести домашние принадлежности, новую технику (телевизор, базу, DVD и другое).
texts.en: Mahmarajab is a resident of the Yavan region.  He is 44 years old.  He is married and has five children.  Since 1997 Mahmarajab has been working as a farmer.  He mostly plants wheat and vegetables.  His family helps him farm.  Not long ago Mahmarajab spent his savings to purchase livestock and does not have enough monetary resources for planting.  This is why he turned to Humo.  He is taking out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  Thanks to the earnings he hopes to improve his financial situation, purchase home furnishings, new technology (television, base, DVD and others).

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large supply of fruits (mandarins, oranges, and mangoes) for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old, married, with four children. She lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Jocelyn manages and owns a retail business to earn a living and every month she earns PHP 5,000. Jocelyn has been in her business for nine years. In 2010, Jocelyn joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ma. Rochelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Rochelyn is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Two of the children are infants and one is in school. They are presently residing at Panlautan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Ma. Rochelyn has been engaged in the buying and selling business for ten years and only earns PHP 8,000 to cover the family's needs.

She has been a Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) member for almost two years and, now, she requests a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase Ready-To-Wear clothing products for resale.

loans.use: to purchase Ready-To-Wear clothing products for resale.

loans.name: Pellumbeshe

texts.en:
Pullumbesha is an Egyptian who lives in a village in the south of Albania.  She is married and has only one child.  She owns a tiny one-room home as shown in the photograph.  She has been described by those in the village as a loving lady and devoted Christian. 

For ten years now, she has been selling her agricultural products to residents of a nearby city.  Even though she plants and sells different kinds of veggies and grains, she also produces large quantities of potatoes and onions.  This is because the soil is best for these items.  The loan she is requesting is to buy potato and onion seeds.  The best time to plant the seeds in within these two months.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds.

loans.name: Jairo Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Jairo, nació en el departamento de Masaya, de oficio electrónico, con edad de 38 años casado, su núcleo familiar conformado por sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

Jairo es dueño de su propio negocio, iniciado con capital propio desde hace 8 años, llamado taller de electrónica, este consiste en reparación de todo tipo de electrodoméstico de uso del hogar, el taller  lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, el adecuo su taller de tal manera que diera las condiciones necesaria para poder brindar el servicio, y que lo ofrece de lunes a sábado ocho horas al día. 

Su negocio ha ido creciendo porque los mismos  clientes que tiene lo han recomendado, por su buen trato hacia el cliente, y que las reparaciones que el realiza son de garantía.

Solicita financiamiento para la compra de  accesorios como repuesto electrónicas, memorias, Ic de tv. Rollos de soldadura, pasta para soldar.
Considera que este préstamo le ayudara  a incrementar sus ingresos y podrá darles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jairo was born in the Masaya department.  He is a 38 year old electronic technician, and he is married.  His family is comprised of his two children and his wife.

Jairo has his own business, which he started with his own capital eight years ago.  He has an electronics workshop, which consists of repairing all types of domestic appliances.  His workshop is in his house.  He adapted his workshop in such a way that he would have the conditions he needs to be able to provide this service.  He works eight hours a day from Mondays through Saturdays.

His business has been growing.  This is because his customers have been recommending him to others due to the good way that he treats his customers and the fact that he guarantees the repairs that he does.

He is requesting the loan to buy accessories like electrical replacement parts, memories, integrated TV circuit boards, rolls of soldering wires, and soldering paste.

He thinks that this loan will help him increase his income, and he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy accessories like electrical replacement parts, memories, integrated TV circuit boards, rolls of soldering wires, and soldering paste.

loans.name: Leida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Leída,  originaria del  municipio de Catarina (Pueblos Blacos) del departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 57 años, y desde hace 31 años ella posee su  propio negocio este consiste en una taller de carpintería, la experiencia la heredo de sus padres, que fueron los que le enseñaron a ganarse la vida desde pequeña y que gracias a ellos ahora tiene su medio de trabajo.

Leída  actualmente tiene la compañía de su esposo, ya que sus 4 hijos son mayores de edad e independiente, ella  se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y honrada.


La mayoría de sus clientes radican en león y estos venden en el mercado municipal de ahí mismo, Leida   viaja a esa zona para poder entregar los pedidos, los productos que ella comercializa son de todo tipo de tal manera que si hay algún pedido que ella no puede elaborar, se dirige a las distintas ventas en Catarina y san Juan de oriente para poder cumplir con el pedido.

 
Actualmente Leida necesita un financiamiento para cumplir con varios pedidos  y necesita comprar una mercadería  el cual consiste en la compra de 3 juegos de comedor, 4 muebles para televisor y juego juegos de carreta, de tal manera que  pueda cubrir con el pedido.

 De esta manera dar un mejor servicio. Esto le ayudara a obtener mejores   ingresos para  su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para una vida digna con su familia.
texts.en:
Leida comes from the town of Catarina (Pueblos Blacos) of the department of Masaya. She's 57 years old and has owned her own business for 31 years. Her business is a carpentry workshop, a trade she inherited from her parents. They're the ones who have taught her to make a living ever since she was young, and today, thanks to them, she has a means of livelihood.
Leida currently has her husband to keep her company, since her four children are independent adults. She's known for being a hardworking, honorable woman.
Most of her customers are established in León and they make their sales in that same town's municipal market. Leida commutes to that area to deliver the orders. She sells all kinds of products, and, if she isn't able to manufacture an order, she goes to various sellers in Catarina and San Juan de Oriente so that she can meet that order.
Leida currently needs a loan in order to meet several orders. She needs to purchase merchandise consisting of three dining room sets, four television racks and furniture carts. That way she'll be able to meet the orders and provide a better service.
This will help her to obtain better profits for her business and to increase her earnings in order to make a decent living alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase three dining room sets, four television racks and furniture carts.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es: Cristino, tiene 33 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Intibucá. Cristino desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 12 años de dedicarse al cultivo de papa y la producción la vende en el mercado local. Don Cristino esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 12,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar insecticidas, fungicidas para darle mantenimiento al cultivo actual y compra de semilla de papa para sembrar de nuevo ya que el siembra escalonadamente. Su meta es seguir con el nivel de producción que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Cristino, 33, is married and has four children; he lives in a village belonging to the municipality of Intibucá.  Since he was very young Cristino has worked in agriculture and has been growing potatoes for 12 years that he sells in the local market.  He’s asking for his second ODEF loan for 12,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy insecticide and fungicide to provide care for his current crop and to buy potato seeds to plant again since he staggers his planting.  His goal is to continue with the level of production he has in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 61 years old, married, with adult-aged children. They are now living at Bolot, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She has engaged in the snack-vending business for two years and earns PHP 13,000 per month to cover her costs of living. 

She requested a loan amounting to PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is single. She is 60 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Dioscora sells sacks of rice to earn a living and has had this business for twenty years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of rice to sell/retail.

Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell/retail.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 36 лет, замужем. У них с мужем трое детей. Назгуль с мужем в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2007 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгуль в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 баранов и одна лошадь и 2,4 га обрабатываемой земли. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 7,500 сом (KGS) от полеводства и животноводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и детали для трактора. Трактор необходимо подготовить для весенних пахотных работ. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота и для улучшения материального благосостояния семьи. Основная цель Назгуль это вырастить детей и дать им хорошее образование.
texts.en: Nazgul is 36 years old, married, and she and her husband have three children. In 2007, Nazgul and her husband used 10,000 KGS to start farming to supplement their income.  Because of her hard work, Nazgul now has two cows, ten sheep, one horse, and 2.4 hectares of arable land on her farm. The farm's monthly income from crops and livestock is about 7,500 KGS. In order to further expand her business, Nazgul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy one cow and tractor parts. The tractor must be ready for the spring plowing. Nazgul plans to invest the income from the loan into expanding her business by buying more cattle and into improving the family's standard of living. Nazgul's primary goal is to raise her children and give them a good education.

loans.use: purchase more cattle

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 44 years old and married with six children. They are all living at Bita-ug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.

Jessie has engaged in this business for three years and earns 6,000 Philippine pesos a month to earn a living. Now she requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to be used as add-up capital for the existing business.

Jessie has been a PMPC member for a year with no bad records.

loans.use: to purchase different snack ingredients and vegetables.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 52, is married with two children and lives in Tukuran, Zamaboanga Del Sur. She manages and owns a food production and sales business, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She's been in her business for almost 16 years and earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month.

Jocelyn joined GDPMC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 3,300 PHP to purchase additional foods and drinks. Jocelyn plans to have a better future for her family and to ensure they finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods and drinks.

loans.name: Rolia

texts.en:
Rolia, 59, is widowed with two children and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 11 years and each month, she earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

Rolia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy products to sell like rice, sugar, coffee, soap and canned goods. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Rolia wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like rice, sugar, coffee, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn, 33, is married with four children and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She operates and owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Sherlyn wants to expand her business and to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Yesenia en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Edwin es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito, es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como todo buen comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Edwin tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin, 44 years old, lives with his life companion, Yesenia, in his own house.  He has a store where he sells basic staple items like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  He’s been in business several years so he’s gained wide sales experience that makes it possible for him to earn higher profits.  The store is located at home in a very busy location so he’s acquired many customers.  People prefer him because he always has what they need: quality products at affordable prices with unequalled service,  he’s always at the disposal of his customers.

Edwin’s a man who is dedicated to his work; he’s energetic and has many goals ahead.  His greatest secret of success is constancy and love of work; he knows that this is the only way he’ll reach what he wants.  Like any good merchant, he wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  Edwin has good payment references and is sure to repay the loan while trusting that he’ll give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk grains, instant foods/beverages, snacks, drinks, and bread.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Don Oscar Danilo, radica en Nandasmo llamado también pueblos blancos por su rica  variedad de elaboración de artesanías hechas a mano y ventas de jardineria, municipio perteneciente al departamento de Masaya. 
Don Oscar tiene la edad de 52 años, casado, su núcleo familiar lo conforma su esposa y sus dos hijos. El  posee su negocio desde hace 12 años, ya que anteriormente le trabajaba a otro taller, experiencia que adquirió de su padre, pero decidió emprender su negocio propio, comenzó elaborando estilos de muebles que le había enseñado su papa, pero vio que la demanda hiba hacia otros estilos modernos, por lo que necesitaba hacer mejores productos con nuevos diseños, que le trajeran mayores ingresos y asi lo hizo.
Ahora tiene sus propios estilos de los cuales siente que han sido aceptados por sus clientes y que tienen mucha demanda y también busca la manera de seguir innovando de tal manera que no se valla quedando atrás en el mercado, lo muebles que ofrece recamaras, gabinetes, puertas y muebles mil uso, comedores, entre otros en fin a tratado de ir teniendo una gran variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra madera de Cedro real, diluyente cener, sellador para madera, tablas de aguacates, pega para madera, tornillos y lijas, y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo, resides in Nandasmo, also known as one of the "Pueblos Blancos" (white villages). It is known for its rich variety of handicrafts and for sales of garden plants. This municipality is part of the Masaya department.

Oscar is 52 years old, married and his immediate family consists of his wife and his two children. He has had a business for 12 years, as previously he worked in another workshop. He gained his experience by working with his father, but decided to launch his own business and began making styles of furniture that his father had taught him. But he saw that the demand was moving toward other modern styles, so he needed to do make better products with new designs that would bring greater income—so he did so

Now he has his own styles, which he feels have been accepted by his customers, and for which there is a great deal of demand. He is also seeking a way to continue innovating, in such a way that he won't find himself being left behind in the market. The furniture that he sells includes bedroom sets, cabinets, doors, dining room tables and other items. In short, he has tried to little by little have a great variety to offer to his customers.

The loan he is requesting is to buy Spanish cedar, paint thinner, wood sealant, aguacate wood, wood glue, screws and sandpaper, so that he can meet his customer demand.

loans.use: To buy Spanish cedar, paint thinner, wood sealant, aguacate wood, wood glue, screws and sandpaper.

loans.name: Jorissa

texts.en:
Jorissa, 28, is married with two children and lives in Poblacion, Ipil, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Jorissa has owned a small piggery to earn a living for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase more feed for her pig farm.
Jorissa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jorissa hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs business

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru:
Махина молодая девочка с добрым и весёлым характером. Ей 23 года, она не замужем живет со своими родителями. Пока не хочет выходить замуж, хочет работать и быть самостоятельной.
Махина по специальности парикмахер. Этим видом деятельности она занимается около 3 лет. У нее есть салон который она арендует.Салон находится далеко от ее дома и ей очень трудно добираться пешком так как маршрутное такси до салона не едит.  Махина несколько лет тому назад успешно закончила курсы вождение автомобиля и получила права. Она посоветовавшись с родителями решила купить не дорогой автомобиль.
  На полученный кредит Махина планирует купить автомобиль и заранее благодарит организацию Кива за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahina is a young girl with a kind and happy personality.  She is 23 years old, she is not married and lives with her parents.  For now she does not want to get married, she wants to work and be independent.

Mahina is a hairdresser by profession.  She has been in this business for around 3 years.  She has a salon that she rents.  The salon is far from her home and it is very difficult for her to get there on foot because the minibus does not go there.  Mahina successfully finished a driving course several years ago and got her license.  Having discussed it with her parents she decided to buy an inexpensive car.  

Mahina plans to use the loan to buy a car and thanks KIVA in advance for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Saydullo

texts.ru:
Сайдулло выращивает различную сельско- хозяйственную культуру. У него  есть 10 Га земли, там он в основном выращивает лук и пшеницу.  Кроме того он выращивает морковь, картошку и кормовую культуру.   В прошлом году  урожай удался и он был доволен, что продал все удачно.  Но у него были трудности с перевозкой урожая так как у него не было автомобиля,  он  накопил но все равно не хватает денежных средств.   Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.  Сейчас Сайдулло хочет повторно посеять семена и надеется,что соберет хороший урожай как в прошлом году.  Он накопил немного денег но на приобретение авто ему не хватает, поэтому хочет получить деньги в кредит и вместе со своими сбережениями купить не дорогой автомобиль.
 Сайдулло очень благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Saydullo grows a variety of agricultural crops. He has ten hectares of land where he mostly grows onions and wheat. In addition, he grows carrots, potatoes and feed crops. Last year's harvest was a success and he was pleased that he successfully sold everything. But he had difficulty with transporting the harvest because he did not have a car.  He has been saving up but still does not have enough money. He therefore appealed to Arvand for financial support. Saydullo now wants to re-plant the seeds and hopes that this year will bring a harvest as good as last year's. He has saved a little money to buy a car but it is not enough; therefore, he wants to take out a loan to supplement his savings and buy an inexpensive automobile. 

Saydullo is very thankful to KIVA for their financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache, 44, is a married mother of three children. She lives with her family in a village belonging to the town of Tiribe.

Kache has had her own grocery store for over 10 years where she sells basic household goods like rice, sugar, salt, coffee, bread, etc. She wants to increase stock in her grocery store in order to increase sales and income. She’s asking for a 50,000 KES loan which will be her sixth loan with Yehu. She’ll use it to buy more products like soft drinks, basic grains, flour, and instant goods to stock her store. Her goal is to expand the business and use profits to do home improvements.

loans.use: to buy more products like soft drinks, basic grains, flour, and instant goods.

loans.name: Benjaline

texts.en:
Benjaline is 52, married and has three children, ages 22, 21 and 15 years old.  Her main source of income is preparing and selling fast food in Awasi. She has been in the business for 0 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has joined a self-help group in KADET LTD and now seeking her first loan of KES 20,000. With it, she intends to purchase cooking fat, bales of maize flour and wheat flour.  

The profits that she gets will be reinvested back to the business and used to educate her school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, maize flour, sugar.

loans.name: Kenjegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул 47 лет, замужем, у них с мужем 3 детей. Сын Кенжегул учится в университете в Бишкеке, дочка замужем,младшая дочка учится в колледже в Таласе.Кенжегул  в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 16 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжегул  и ее семьи, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжегул  обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов коров для увеличения доходов от продажи молока и молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита Кенжегул  будет вкладывать в дальнейшее образование детей и улучшение благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kenjegul is 47 years old, married, and she and her husband have three children. Kenjegul's son is studying at the university in Bishkek. One daughter is married, and the youngest daughter in college in Talas. Kenjegul is the primary source of income for her family.  She started her animal husbandry business 16 years ago with 5,000 KGS. Because of Kenjegul and her family's hard work, the farm currently has two dairy cows. In order to further expand her business, Kenjegul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional cows to increase her revenue from the sale of milk and dairy products. Kenjegul plans to invest the income from the loan in her children's education and the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 29 years old, married and has two children. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a school where she provides education for children. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are residents from the nearby town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delayed payment from students' parents and guardians. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy teaching kits. Her business goal is to expand her school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She was able to pay her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy teaching kits

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 39 years old. She is described as a hard-working woman who is very cheerful and really wants to get ahead. She lives with her husband and her three children, outside the town of Tiribe.

Bahati works alone, selling different types of dishes and snacks. She has a small stall at the market. Seeing that her business is growing every day, Bahati has decided to take out a Yehu Microfinance Trust loan, which will be invested in buying flour, vegetables, sugar, beans, cooking fats, etc. This will help her obtain better production of the food she sells and better income for her family. 

Bahati dreams of her income being higher, to be able to establish a bigger cafe, to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy flour, vegetables, sugar, beans, cooking fats, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 43 years old, married, with two children who are adult-aged. They live together in Olo, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Genie has engaged in the general store business for fifteen years and earns PHP 4,000 that supports the family's daily living.
